channel.title: Paint Pad - Multi-User Drawing
channel.description:
You people know MsPaint and PhotoShop where you can draw freehand? This is like that, except two people can connect together, what one person draws will appear on the other persons screen as well.
This is a screenshot of two of these connected through localhost 127.0.0.1
[URL=http://img78.imageshack.us/img78/4504/paintpaddemoag1.png][IMG]http://img78.imageshack.us/img78/4504/paintpaddemoag1.th.png[/img][/URL]
I'm fairly sure something like this has been made before, but I made it anyway
Thanks a lot to everyone who made their programs open source, i learned a lot from other people here
I'v already used to this to draw with someone almost on the other side of the world, it was efficent enough for that, everytime it sends a curve it only sends 7 bytes.
Please comment on this, and tell me why I can't get it to run as an applet, thats really annoying me :(
Remember you can connect to yourself with localhost
So what do you think? :)

item.title: Paint Pad - Multi-User Drawing
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

this is the error that a seperate class give, seems like im not allowed to access files on my own computer :rolleyes:

this thread is becoming like a two-way converstation, do you have IRC or something?

java.security.AccessControlException: access denied (java.util.PropertyPermission user.dir read) at java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(Unknown Source) at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPropertyAccess(Unknown Source) at java.lang.System.getProperty(Unknown Source) at java.io.Win32FileSystem.getUserPath(Unknown Source) at java.io.Win32FileSystem.resolve(Unknown Source) at java.io.File.getAbsolutePath(Unknown Source) at sun.awt.shell.Win32ShellFolder2.<init>(Unknown Source) at sun.awt.shell.Win32ShellFolder2.listFiles(Unknown Source) at sun.awt.shell.ShellFolder.listFiles(Unknown Source) at sun.awt.shell.Win32ShellFolderManager2.get(Unknown Source) at sun.awt.shell.ShellFolder.get(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalFileChooserUI.updateUseShellFolder(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalFileChooserUI.installComponents(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicFileChooserUI.installUI(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalFileChooserUI.installUI(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JComponent.setUI(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JFileChooser.updateUI(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JFileChooser.setup(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JFileChooser.<init>(Unknown Source) at javax.swing.JFileChooser.<init>(Unknown Source) at PaintPad.<init>(PaintPad.java:135) at PaintPadApplet.init(PaintPadApplet.java:11) at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Read full topic

Perhaps because it’s a nested class? That might be the problem.

item.title: Paint Pad - Multi-User Drawing
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

this is the nested class

	public class Applet extends JApplet {

		public void init() { //ideal size should be 616,628

			//dimension is the size of the drawable panel
			//the second param is the parent for JDialogs
			//the third is 'boolean runningAsApplication'
			PaintPad content = new PaintPad(new Dimension(600,550),this,false);
			this.setContentPane(content.getMainPanel());
			this.setJMenuBar(content.getMainMenuBar());
		}
	}

the html is

<center>

<applet
code=PaintPad$Applet.class
width=612
height=628
alt="java disabled">
applet tag ignored
</applet>

</center>

the stack trace printed to the sun console is


load: PaintPad$Applet.class can't be instantiated.
java.lang.InstantiationException: PaintPad$Applet
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin.AppletViewer.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.runLoader(Unknown Source)
	at sun.applet.AppletPanel.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

i dont think i can make a server because for that i have to leave my computer on all the time,
unless theres another way?

i also found a website which has a flash object, that does a very similar thing
http://www.imaginationcubed.com/imagine

any ideas on why it cant work as an applet? (the applet class is the very last nested class in the file PaintPad.java)

Read full topic
